resources.string: Press the drone to manage it!
We decided to work on the creation of a drone starting from scratch for our 7th semester.
Droninio team is a group of 7 students in the engineering school of Polytech Orl√©ans from the specialty ESPE (Embedded Systems and Physics Engineering).
We all have different backgrounds but the same interest for embedded systems and emerging technologies.
We have chosen a substantial project which we divided into multiple subjects in order to work on different languages, devices and fields of knowledge.
In charge of the Arduino program I worked hardly to make the drone fly and stable in any condition. I also wrote the part concerning the Wi-Fi to allow the app to connect to the drone.
I was the link between the different teams and worked hard to motivate the team and finish in time. My goal was to keep the group united in terms of quality of work and work speed.
Member of the Arduino department I mainly drove the part concerning the adaptability of the environment. I also looked into the code about the GPS.
I am the one who created the website. I tried to create the best user experience so you can enjoy exploring our website. I also studied the connection with the app.
In charge of the app you needed to control your drone, I worked hard to create an intuitive and simple interface. I coded the translation of the Arduino into an Android controller.
My job was to build the drone and create the different electronic boards useful for our project. I also made the cabling and different wiring diagrams.
My job was to draw the wiring diagrams and to solder the components on the different electronic cards. I worked with Alexandre to go faster and follow the Arduino group.
We were free to choose any subject we were interested in to improve the skills we wanted.
